parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

parameters.name: brandId
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned to the merchant brand

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned to the merchant company

parameters.name: paymentType
parameters.description: value :VRP, VRPCommercial

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Indicates the Payit version used. For Payit version 3 use 'application/app.v3+json' value

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Indicates the Payit version used. For Payit version 3 use 'application/app.v3+json' value

parameters.name: x-consent-ID
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the consent.This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

parameters.name: x-user-consent
parameters.description:
x-user-consent = true then consent page is not displayed to user 
          x-user-consent <> true then consent page is displayed to user

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: payload

post.description:
This API will be hosted by merchants & Payit application will consume the API. Payit will consume this API when : -
A> Payit returns the consent confirmation status back to merchant 
B> Payit experienced a non recoverable technical error in core PISP Journey.
C> End customer decides to close the browser session while on core PISP screens

parameters.name: ConsentConfirm-Param
parameters.description: Default

consentPayitId.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

bankConsentId.description: Bank consent id . bankConsentId is sent only when the consent reaches the bank

consentStatus.description: Specifies the status of payment in code form.

statusDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource status was updated All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

parameters.name: x-consent-ID
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the consent. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

parameters.name: payit-signature
parameters.description: signature to prevent replay attacks

x-consent-ID.description: Original consent id generated by Merchant

consentPayitId.description: Original consent id generated by Payit

MerchantAcknowledgementId.description: A unique identifier generated by the Merchant on receipt  of the payment status update.

CreationDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

post.description:
This API will be hosted by merchants & Payit application will consume the API. Payit will consume this API when : -
A> Payit returns the payment confirmation status back to merchant when Customer is in browser session.
B> Payit experienced a non recoverable technical error in core PISP Journey.
C> End customer decides to close the browser session while on core PISP screens

parameters.name: PaymentConfirm-Param
parameters.description: Default

PaymentReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the bank for the payment

TPPReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

description.description: Description for the payment, to be displayed to the user

Status.description: Specifies the status of payment in code form.

eventName.description: For 'CustomerAbortedJourney' status, extra details will be provided at which step the journey is aborted at. For 'OtherError', 'TechnicalError', 'PaymentRejected' statuses empty value is typically sent. In the specific case of unconfirmed funds, even though the status is 'TechnicalError', the event name will be sent as 'transaction_cancelled_funds_unavailable'

StatusDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource status was updated All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

parameters.name: x-transaction-ID
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Related to EndToEndIdentification field in open banking journey

parameters.name: Payit-signature
parameters.description: signature to prevent replay attacks

x-transaction-ID.description: Original transaction id generated by Merchant

x-tpp-ID.description: Original TPP id generated by Payit

MerchantAcknowledgementId.description: A unique identifier generated by the Merchant on receipt  of the payment status update.

CreationDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

patch.description:

A> Payit returns the payment confirmation status back to merchant when original payment was a non terminal status

parameters.description: Default

Status.description: Specifies the status of payment in code form.

parameters.name: x-transaction-ID
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Related to EndToEndIdentification field in open banking journey

parameters.name: Payit-signature
parameters.description: signature to prevent replay attacks

parameters.name: PaymentReferenceID
parameters.description: Payment reference generated by the banks

parameters.name: TPPReferenceID
parameters.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

MerchantAcknowledgementId.description: A unique identifier generated by the Merchant on receipt  of the payment status update.

post.description: Initiates a new refund payment flow

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Indicates the Payit version used. For Payit version 3 use 'application/app.v3+json' value

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: payload

post.description: Merchant Api where Payit provide refund status

parameters.name: payit-signature
parameters.description: signature generated by Payit application to prevent replay attacks

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: payload

post.description: to be used when the merchant wants to receive the latest version of reconciliation files

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Id of the company/merchant that saves version

parameters.name: reconciliationVersion
parameters.description: Version to be saved and used from now on, can only be one of the supported versions

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

400.description: Version not supported or merchant doesn't exist.

parameters.name: filetype
parameters.description: Type of reconciliation files available for merchant to download. The files are of below types :-  a) Failed - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is failed b) Successful - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is Successful  c) Inprogress - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is Inprogress d) InprogCompleted - The transaction originated BEFORE the reconciliation file generation window and terminal status of the transaction is Successful/Rejected **** Sample file generation window - from 2018-06-05T00:00:00+00:00 till 2017-04-05T23:59:59+00:00***

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: date for which the file needs to be download for. Format is 2018-06-05

parameters.name: run
parameters.description: Applicable for the intra date multiple reconciliation file. If the merchant has one file generated per reconciliation file generation window ie - from 2018-06-05T00:00:00+00:00 till 2018-06-05T23:59:59+00:00 , Then set the field as 0001

parameters.name: companyIdentification
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned to the merchant company

parameters.name: brandIdentification
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned to the merchant brand

parameters.name: x-FOV-indicator
parameters.description: For production environments do not send this field or send it as false. Fov indicator will be used by to test new features in production , yet these features are not open to public - First occurrence Validation.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

200.description: Payit application will contain the Reconciliation File direct URL.

daterun.description: date on which the file was generated.

schema.description: contains the direct URL for the Reconciliation file location

redirectUrl.description: The same url for onboarding has to be added

totalRefundAmount.description: this field contains total refund amount

TPPReferenceID.description: contains the original payment transaction id / ttp id generated by payit application for the transaction.

PaymentReferenceID.description: Contains the orignial payment id supplied to merchant by payit application for the transaction.

refundAmount.description: contains the amount to be refunded to payment service user (PSU), Can contain full or the partial amount.  Goodwill refund will be checksfor the threshold set.

refundDescription.description: Description for the refund, to be displayed to the user

tppRefundACKId.description: The unique identifier generated by the merchant for the refund response

XtransactionID.description: contains the original payment end to end id generated by merchant for the transaction.

TPPReferenceID.description: contains the original payment transaction id / ttp id generated by payit application for the transaction.

fpReference.description: contains the payment unique fpReference generated by Payit

refundAmount.description: contains the amount to be refunded to payment service user (PSU), Can contain full or the  partial amount.  Goodwill refund will be checksfor the threshold set.

refundDescription.description: contains the reason of the refund sent by merchant

tppRefundACKId.description: contains the payit ack generated at merchant refund response.

refundFPReference.description: contains a unique refund id generated for refund transactions.

additionalInformation.description: additional information aiding status of the refund
additionalInformation.example: Merchant brand is not in correct status

MerchantAcknowledgementId.description: A unique identifier generated by the Merchant on receipt  of the payment statusupdate.

CreationDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource was created. Alldates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601  date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses  must include the timezone. An example is 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00.

Code.description: High level textual error code, to help categorise the errors.

Id.description: A unique reference for the error instance, for audit purposes, in case of unknown/unclassified errors. An RFC4122 UID used as a Error id

Message.description: Brief Error message, e.g., 'There is something wrong with the request parameters provided'

ReconciliationVersion.description: Version to be saved and used from now on, can only be one of the supported versions.
